entry.title: To August
entry.summary: To August, With you the waining leaves always meant the rising pain. The absurd loneliness seemed to envelope the miniscule emerging happiness. Be gentle now. My legs are tired. I look at the skies of the leaving monsoon, And no echo. I've sat now. I'm…
entry.content:
To August,
With you the waining leaves always meant the rising pain.Â 
The absurd loneliness seemed to envelope the miniscule emerging happiness.
Be gentle now.
My legs are tired.
I look at the skies of the leaving monsoon,
And no echo.
I've sat now.
I'm tired of walking.
I've been meaning to lay down,
But I am also scared of sleeping.
Be gentle now.
Just this once, for my sake August,
Be gentle for my sake.
